website_summaries.verdict: A very inexpensive way to become your own captain and enjoy fishing at your own pace.
pros: Comes with a pump and oars
Folds to a nice compact size when deflated
Can hold a lot of gear
Can be mounted with an engine
cons: The boat is a nice size, but not really big enough for four adults
Two adults and a child will be comfortable

website_summaries.verdict: A durable model by a trusted name in inflatable rafting and boating equipment. If you are looking for one to fit a group for an enjoyable time on the water, it has a lot to offer and isn't very costly.
pros: An easy-to-inflate and handle model that has a seriously tough PVC vinyl build
Comes with a pump and aluminum oars, and has oar and fishing rod holders
Earns praise for its true fit that accommodates most 4-person groups
cons: Seats are a bit uncomfortable due to nonexistent back support

customer_reviews.title: Freakin Awesome, Fun and, Compact.
customer_reviews.text: If you don't see the value in being on a lake and fishing for just over 100 bucks idk what to tell you. This thing has been an absolute freakin blast. I kinda speed fill mine with a battery powered shop vac until it's close to full then finish it off with the hand pump so it's at the correct pressure. I also suck all the air out of it the same way. For ease of rolling it back up. I also bought an extra large duffle bag and the boat, oars, hand pump, and trolling motor mount can all be slung over my shoulder on the way to the water. " GIANT " Duffle bag Big 5.
customer_reviews.author: Loren J. Wingenfeld

customer_reviews.title: This boat is not sturdy enough to put seats in it but if u ...
customer_reviews.text: Its really a two man boat but myself and my dad took it out on the bay in about a 5mph breeze with no real issues. We are both big guys about 215 and 230 and we stayed afloat hahaha. The hardest part it anchoring it when there are some waves. This boat is not sturdy enough to put seats in it but if u sit on the floor its fine for an hour or so.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Inflated great, sure got a work out lol
customer_reviews.text: I took it out twice this past weekend. First day with two 11 year olds, Inflated great, sure got a work out lol. On the second day took it out with one 11 yr old and a 7 yr old. couldn't figure out how to lock in the ores on the boat but since i had the kids it was easier to kind of row the boat like a kayak. The kids wanted to tip us over just to get all the way in the lake lol, um NO. Boat was sturdy, kind of a pain to roll back up small enough to get in my small car but worth the money i paid for it
customer_reviews.author: sweetiepie2013

customer_reviews.title: Inflated length is 7' 7" for anyone else that's curious
customer_reviews.text: I just got this boat in the mail and went ahead to inflate it right away to find out if I'll need to register it or not. If you're in California you gotta register if it's over 8' and I'm happy to report it is about 7' 7" meaning that I can take it straight to the lake without waiting at the DMV. I'll be testing the waters this weekend and update my review if there's any problems. Otherwise, it looks like pretty sturdy material and isn't leaking from what I can tell. I'm 5' 8" and can sit comfortably on one end of it, leaving plenty of space for another person my size if we sit cross legged.
customer_reviews.author: Tompy

customer_reviews.title: This is a fun little boat for rowing around on ponds and lakes
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun little boat for rowing around on ponds and lakes. It only takes about 10 minutes to inflate and a little more to deflate, and it folds up small enough to put in the trunk. My son loves being in the water in this boat. My only complaint is that the pump has popped apart a couple of times, and, even though I was able to fix it, it's obviously not perfect. The package is well worth the money, especially if your boating needs are simple.
customer_reviews.author: R. M. M.

customer_reviews.title: Won’t Hold Air
customer_reviews.text: I blew it up for the first time when I took it on vacation. We were very disappointed because it won’t hold air. We blew it up with an electric pump by intel and it had collapsed by morning. I’m very unhappy. We had to fish from the shore all week. This never hit the water. I didn’t want to blow it up before we reached Prescott Arizona. I think I deserve a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Mossy

customer_reviews.title: Family Friendly but Very Heavy, Not a Longterm Option
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this! We used it with my four young kids three times and then we inflated it and it started to deflate quickly until it was almost entirely deflated. I can’t find a hole to patch it! It’s also very very heavy, which is maybe expected for its size but very difficult for a small 5’0” woman to carry on my own. I would recommend if you have someone strong to carry it. I was very disappointed it didn’t last us longer and would have returned it but it’s now a week past the one month return date 🙈
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: I love this boat
customer_reviews.text: I love this boat. At first I was a bit uncertain about the boat holding up but held up pretty well. Two adults one child cooler fishing gear and all worked out great. My son loved it also. I would recommend it. My friend that was with us said he might buy him self one.
customer_reviews.author: sergio c.

customer_reviews.title: Too bad it had a hole in the seam within a ...
customer_reviews.text: Boat floated well and had decent steering. Too bad it had a hole in the seam within a year and is now useless. Cheap quality. I am awaiting a response from them regarding warranty and hope this was just a bad copy. Will update.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I use it as a dinghy in a 24 foot boat to blow up as needed when we island camp. I use an auto pump. Hand pumping would take a while. We hauled gear from the boat buoy in the Puget Sound and then the kids played all day in it while camping. Saltwater and rocky shore and kids I thought would be a disaster but it did not tear. For the money this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this tough little raft. It tracks very well in the water. I pull it behind my 49cc 4 stroke 5G bought from bikeberry on Amazon. I created this whole set up from Amazon. Except the bike. The boat is awesome. I can't wait to put a small outboard on it since I can buy a motor mount bracket that will fit right on it. I would buy again. Even my dog's nails are no match for the tough sides.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: To Boat, Or Not To Boat
customer_reviews.text: There was ABSOLUTELY NOTHING that i did not about our new family add on. This is our 4th boat, however we lost one due to my idiocy. My niece has decided to name it 'Tinkerbell', and Tink performed beautifully for my GF n I during our vay-K. My uncle has a HUGE lake in his backyard,& I took Stacy on a serenaded ride. It was a smooth, comfortable, and esoteric wade in the water. We even got compliments on Tinkerbell from my uncle's neighbors, quoting "You've got a better boat than ours. Wanna trade?" AMAZING piece of ingenuity that can't be passed up amongst outdoor activities. KUDOS!!!
customer_reviews.author: DaCarllo McCormick

customer_reviews.title: More Than Expected Quality And Durability
customer_reviews.text: My 'Seahawk' is more fun, more practical, than any other inflatable I've ever owned. I haven't used it with a motor yet, but it will cut through the lake waters just fine with the sturdy, well-designed oars that came with it. As advertised in every respect, I can fish or just take a row out into the lake without having to drag a trailer behind me with all its associated hookups. Fits easily in my trunk or even in the backseat at a moment's notice!
customer_reviews.author: Bluesy

customer_reviews.title: this is a great boat very strong very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I had the 3 man boat with a 1.5 electric motor. It was east to inflate very durable and light. Sadly the mice got to it and I was devastated to say the least.. So for any a couple of dollars more bought the 4 man. Now I have a little extra room for more gear and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Bregensb

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and mobile but easily punctured
customer_reviews.text: This boat has taken me on some once in a lifetime adventures. Without a motor it isn't necesairy to register in the state of Indiana so i can legally be out on the water amywhere i please. Deflates and folds to easily take up only a quarter of my cars trunk. It is unbelievably versatile but it is essential that it not be scraped along concrete or gravel or else it will pop. I have managed to stop a couple little leaks with some adhesive and it is still doing me well after 3 years but it will not last if not cared for properly.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a half dozen times
customer_reviews.text: I won't buy another cheap inflatable again. I got this along with a trolling motor, built a floor, etc. It's been great for the few times it lasted. But today when I went to inflate it, the bottom air chamber's seam was leaking. It was fine yesterday. It's roughly a 1/2" tear. I'll try to repair, and update the review if customer support helps (only had for six weeks), but I'll be really bummed if this much plastic goes to waste.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Solid boat!
customer_reviews.text: I've used it about 7-8 times now, and it works really well. Stays inflated, and the pump works to blow it up in about 10 minutes or so. My bf broke the pump trying to blow it up too fast but was able to fix it easily & it still works just fine. Some cup holders would be nice on the boat but besides that it's perfect for 2 people & a cooler or 3 people depending on how big you are. I gave a little lower stars on value for money because it's consistently been 20+ dollars cheaper since I bought it... isn't that the way it goes? All in all it's worth your time.
customer_reviews.author: Haylie

customer_reviews.title: It's really amazing quality. I was weary of an inflatable boat ...
customer_reviews.text: We've taken this boat out a couple of times now on the lake near our house. It's really amazing quality. I was weary of an inflatable boat because I was scared it would be too unstable. But it has been really amazing. It is so sturdy. I always overpack on our fishing trips and it's always really spacious. Really really couldn't say enough good things about this boat. We even accidentally rowed over a jagged rock and it didn't even care.
customer_reviews.author: J Bee

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Received today aired it up. Amazed, I have a $500. inflatable about twenty years old that's not this nice. The material is thick and stiff should be hard to stick a hook in it. The rod holders have inserts to stiffen them I would actually use them. The paddles are suprizingly strong as are the handle on the front and all hardware. Comes with bag that should have snapped to the inside but find no snaps on the inside. The bag itself is heavy duty with velcro closure. The ends are large I weigh 203 and have no doubt I can sit on the top of either end with no problem. Fantastic deal expected a kiddy toy.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for Casual Boat Stuff
customer_reviews.text: This boat met all of my expectations. The construction is great. It's super easy to inflate and deflate- takes a little practice to properly deflate. On the water, it was super easy to use and row. It's good for a family size of 2 adults plus 1 kid, or 1 adult plus 2 kids. Anything more, you probably should go for a larger boat. Like all inflatable things, think about how you will store it. It took me a bit to figure out how to properly store it in the garage. Definitely much easier to store than a solid boat.
customer_reviews.author: Mayrut

customer_reviews.title: Pump pump pump it up
customer_reviews.text: Paid a couple extra bucks to get the 3 vs the 4 because in MN you have to license bigger than this one. Worth it. Plenty of room for my day arse (250lbs) and my 2 demon spawn. Fishing pole holders hold fishing poles. Paddles paddle. Have inflated/deflated well over 30 times in the past month. Land of 10000 lakes an all. I get around. And so does my raft.
customer_reviews.author: DIRTY

customer_reviews.title: Very Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: WASTE OF MONEY! We used this boat literally once and then put it on a safe place for the next day, the next day there was a big hole on the seam and it was not fixable.
customer_reviews.author: H B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The Intex Seahawk is perfect for the price. It feels a little small for two people but works fine for one person also. It feels very sturdy on the water, and the orders are pretty nice considering the price. If you just want to get out on the water and have a good time, specifically in freshwater such as a pond or a lake, this is the boat for you.
customer_reviews.author: Erohs1

customer_reviews.title: We REALLY wanted to love this boat
customer_reviews.text: We REALLY wanted to love this boat, but the one that came had a teeny tiny hole somewhere in it. Only discovered it while we were out on a lake with the kids (having a blast) and noticed it starting to deflate slightly. Fortunately we brought the pump with us so didn't get stranded. We tried all kinds of methods (spray down with soap, etc) to find the hole, to no avail, so ended up returning. Will reorder a new one for next summer because it was an awesome little boat otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Finch

customer_reviews.title: A Challenge to Paddle
customer_reviews.text: This boat took a while to inflate but the included pump did the job. It held up well to 3 people with a combined weight of 355 pounds. However, it was very difficult to paddle by myself...especially in a river with a healthy current. Maybe an outboard motor would help. The depth made me feel secure in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Hetrick

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this two-seater Seahawk to take to local lakes for fishing. Having been favorably impressed with our Intex inflatable hot tub, we were happy to see that the boat was equally sturdy and well-constructed. A lot of features for the price! This model is fairly small; not much room to move around. I sit sideways with my feet hanging over the side, and that helps. We like that it’s small enough to fit in the back of our van (inflated), and it’s very light to carry. But for larger people, you would probably want the next bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Sherman Kane

customer_reviews.title: Livid
customer_reviews.text: Would give zero stars. Boat takes forever to inflate (that is if the pump does not break in half) and after all your hard work pumping it up, get used to it because every 5 minutes you will be pumping it up. Waste of my time money and effort.
customer_reviews.author: jay schoonmaker

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a boat to carry our stuff when floating down a local lazy river. It held a full cooler, a few dry bags and plenty of other misc things. It is pretty rugged and made it down the river with no drama. Should be able to use this again and again for years. Plus I used the paddles that come with it for use while sitting in my tube. I was able to only attach one of the pipes so its very short and perfect to use in a tube.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: We are using this in our pool but it would be perfect for ponds, small lakes, and rivers as well. It is made well and holds up to my kids jumping on and off. It is made with a thicker material so it won't puncture ad easily as some with a thinner plastic. It was pretty easy to inflate with a little muscle power. We had it ready to go in about 10 minutes. The handles make carrying it much easier. Would definitely purchase again!!
customer_reviews.author: Mammabear

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I've taken it out 2 times now. I strongly recommend getting a good chair for back support when rowing. A floor would be nice but is not necessary unless you plan to constantly stand up. I can easily row around my nearby lake in Shawnee Mission Park, Google it if you'd like to see what it's like for comparison to what you'll use it for. I can easily row, but there's no good back support, so get a chair. I intend to fish from it eventually and I'll update then if I remember it.
customer_reviews.author: Austin C.

customer_reviews.title: Best Father's day gift ever as it provided quality outdoor ...
customer_reviews.text: Got my first one three years ago as a Father's day gift. My son and I used it several summers rafting a small shallow river, Best Father's day gift ever as it provided quality outdoor time with my son and me. Now that he is older (and taller) we bought a second raft and the adventures continue.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Courville

customer_reviews.title: Toy product, toy paddles, you cannot use in a lake
customer_reviews.text: This was the best rated Intex boat. I got it to accompany my significant other while he is fishing in a lake. One of the problems is the toy paddles, not suitable for rowing at all. Most of the time I ended up rotating at the same position, without being able to advance forward. This boat is no different than inflatable pool mats. If you want actually something that you can use to go forward and in the direction you want, get a something else. Waste of time and money. It ruined our trip to the Sierras.
customer_reviews.author: i o

customer_reviews.title: Nice inflatable boat.
customer_reviews.text: This boat comes with seats that cant be attached to the boat so they move all over the place and aren't really of any use so you have to kneel to row comfortably and is difficult to get in/out of. It's listed as a 3 man boat but me being big it's more of a 2 man boat. The oars are great and easy to put together and take apart. The boat moves over the water well but I'm already looking for another boat and will let the grand-kids use this one.
customer_reviews.author: Titanium 7

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: After many uses in lakes and ponds, the two Seahawk rafts that I purchased are still holding up perfectly well, with no punctures or deformations to notice. The included oars are also very durable, and don't bend when rowing vigorously. The "3-person" claim can be a bit of a stretch - two average adults fit comfortably, but things start becoming fairly cramped with three. I would recommend investing in a larger sized pump, as it does take a while to inflate the three separate chambers with the one included in the package. For the price, this is a great raft set.
customer_reviews.author: Arcanaeus

customer_reviews.title: Great for casual fun on the lake
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our lake vacation and had a blast. It hold 2 large adults well enough. Cramped in size but it worked fine. We also had 2 kids and an adult and it worked great. Solidly built and the included pump is a life saver. The boat is high quality, easy to assemble, shipped quickly and arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: JDubb

customer_reviews.title: Inflatable boat
customer_reviews.text: My husband and i bought this for our family for when we go to the lake it was perfect. 4 us fit me, my husband who is 6 ft if i might add and my 2 boys my 6 and 10 yr old. If your all adults i think 2-3people would fit comfortably. I would take the recommendations of putting something inside to make it more sturdy to stand etc. For fishing but if it's just for fun it's perfect as is.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Huerta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs
customer_reviews.text: We live on a slough which frequently fills with water hyacinths. Ge got this to go out and help keep it clean. The hand pump does a decent job of filling it up, but takes a bit of effort. The boat is sturdy for two adults. Be careful to tighten the locking nuts on the oars enough, otherwise they are prone to separating while you're trying to row. Luckily they seem to float.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the price, very durable and easy to inflate and deflate.
customer_reviews.text: We found these little boats very easy to inflate using an electric pump (purchased separately) and then "top off" with the hand pump that is included or add air if needed using the hand pump. They are extremely durable as I, an adult male, went along a river that had a few river rocks and some obstacles that the little boat took without puncture or damage. The oars were adequate in the oar holders provided on the boat but others in our group, including younger children 10-12 years old, used the oars like a canoe and that seemed to work just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cavalere

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: For the price this boat is great. It's compact when not inflated and easily fits into small sedan trunk. It's relative lightweight. Paddles don't sink. There are 3 different inflatable chambers. My 6 years old son can inflate it. The only thing - boat barely moves when one person paddles, but if you paddle in pair - it works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Sergiy

customer_reviews.title: The paddles are trash.
customer_reviews.text: I took this to an alpine lake, assembled the boat and paddles, and got out on the lake. The paddles could not withstand three paddles before they broke. I reassembled them and tried again. Both broke multiple times, leaving us in danger because the water is too cold to swim in without becoming hypothermic. I contacted the manufacturer with no response. The boat is fine, the paddles are trash. I am extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Evan and Kelly

customer_reviews.title: WOW...WHAT FUN THIS IS!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these used at a yard sale. Within 6 weeks I now have a Seahwak 4 and another Seahawk 2. Have ordered 2 more for friends who want to join me on the TN River! We are having a blast! Bought 2 motors and mounts (obviously) and use one of the little boats to haul all the gear. I also made a floor for the one I use (Seahawk 2). Check out this!!!! Love these boats.
customer_reviews.author: Constance Stoner

customer_reviews.title: Inflatable Enjoyment
customer_reviews.text: I love this boat. I can maneuver this myself, am over 65. I use Jr for I love this boat.I can maneuver it myself, am over 65. I have an acre pond and when I need to take care of weed, scum,etc I'm able to get in myself an take care of the problem. Then, I can use it to relax in and watch the ducks,herons,egrets,and take pictures. I
customer_reviews.author: cioc Christine

customer_reviews.title: We were able to enjoy this boat hours on end
customer_reviews.text: This boat is large enough to hold three adult size individuals and a German Shepherd. The thick, Durable quality of the material held up very well against the nails of my German Shepherd. We were able to enjoy this boat hours on end, multiple days in a row on our camping vacation and look forward to many many more. Tons of room. My three teenage children took it out on their own one day with food and played uno on it in the sun for a good two hours. Plenty of room!
customer_reviews.author: Keypsake

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't Sunk Yet!
customer_reviews.text: We've only taken this raft out once, but it held up well and was just roomy enough for two adults. The three-person designation is inaccurate! The oars that come with the raft are too short and hard to grip, so we're considering buying ones that work better. I think with some modifications (new seats!) this raft will work well for lake fishing and paddling about.
customer_reviews.author: Jon R. Herman

customer_reviews.title: quality boat
customer_reviews.text: I read all the comments on here for this product! So i ended up buying it! My family (3 people) took it to a lake last weekend. We filled it up in the morning and it lasted the whole day. We fished on it using the two fishing rod holders. We are going to buy two more ores to add to the boat so my husband and I can row together. It did great in good ol Wyoming wind! We didn't stand up in the boat but are thinking about putting in a carpeted floor to help it become sturdy as a prior customer review advised. For a cheap price it is the best! I would highly reccomend!!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Raya

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and great price.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I got this until we have a truck ti haul kyacks and it is perfect for the little lake by our house. We wouldn't recommend taking it on a high current lake without a motor. I am 5'1 and 125lbs and my husband is 6' and 190lbs. We put a towel on the bottom and a cooler for my husband to sit on in the back. It takes about 10-15 minutes to inflate with the hand pump. The material is duarble.
customer_reviews.author: Tay

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for 2 people
customer_reviews.text: Fits 2 people very comfortably...you can both lounge back with plenty of room. The ores are really good quality...not cheap plastic that breaks if you row too hard. It has the quick release plugs so it deflates easily and quicker. I use an electric pump to inflate mine but the one it came with is a good size.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Great Boat!
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest thing I have ever done. I put a wood bottom a batter and a trolling motor on it and it performs like a champ. My wife, who thought I was crazy even went out on it and loved it. I have been fishing in it a few times with two men. I have a cooler, bag, tackle, batt box, and a large portable boat seat. It is hard to row with wind and weight and against tide so def get a trolling motor! I ordered a seahawk 2 as well that I am going to configure for solo use. (easier to handle in and out of water). Oh, it was easy to get registered as well.
customer_reviews.author: will in jax

customer_reviews.title: Solid boat for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The manual air pump for this boat is super impressive as I was able to inflate this boat faster with the manual pump than a friend of mine was with his electric pump and on smaller raft. Took the boat down the river, everything held up great. No issues in holding the passengers/coolers. Did not use the paddles, so I can't review that portion of the overall package. Would definitely buy again based on quality of boat, air pump, and price.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Williams

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Have only used it once, to haul gear on recent river kayak camping trip. It got some scrapes on rocks w/o incident and no immediate leaks. Good size and appears to be good quality for the price. To give some additional space, we did not inflate the interior chamber (just outside and bottom chambers). I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Talkeetna

customer_reviews.title: Solid boat!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really solid raft! It was really surprisingly easy to inflate even just with the pump that comes with it. I took the wife and 2 kids out on the Lake the 1st weekend we got it and it performed really well. The spot where the oars connect to the raft is really generously sturdy. I bought at 1st that it might not work but it held up beyond expectations
customer_reviews.author: Wayne P. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: More durable than you think an inflatable would be.
customer_reviews.text: I love this boat, my son loves it, his friends love it. It was well worth the money I paid for it. I went and rented a kayak to go down a river a couple of weeks after I bought this boat. When I got to the rental place I was surprised to see these exact same boats are the "rafts" they rent out for use on the Muskegon river here in Michigan. So that confirmed what I had thought in my own experience with them. Over all, I can say if you buy one of these you probably won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Used for recreation and fishing on lake while camping. It saw lots of use between fishing and kids. A little difficult to row, especially if windy. Plenty of room for 1 or 2 to fish from. Heavy duty, but did get a small hole from a thorn. Easy to patch with included kit. Used for 2 years, and will use again this year. Very happy with product.
customer_reviews.author: farmfletch

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for a family of 4
customer_reviews.text: This boat worked out great for our camping trip. It was 4 of us (2 kids ages 7&9 and 2 adults) on it and we were comfortable. Inflating it took a little bit but we have electric pumps so it wasn't bad. We carry our boats to the river about 1/4 mile and it was a little heavy but manageable. We didn't use the seats so I don't know if they would of made it more comfortable. Because it's a pretty big boat you will need at least 2 adults to row it.
customer_reviews.author: Leo R.

customer_reviews.title: Great little rowboat...not a sailboat tender
customer_reviews.text: I probably misused this boat by dragging it behind my sailboat so I could use it as a scalloping platform in shallow water. It's huge and heavy. It would need a rigid floor if you plan to use it much. I gave it to a friend when I got back from the trip. Not what I expected, but very affordable. If I launched it from shore, rowed out a bit and otherwise used it as probably intended, I'd have been happier. I wound up with lost oars because the clips are not positive (I should have stowed them inside during towing).
customer_reviews.author: Ray_Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Actually pretty cool boat
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and easy to inflate with electric compressor. Seems very well made and sturdy. We used them in the lake. No issues. We might use them to float in a small river.
customer_reviews.author: Johannes H. Benink Jr.

customer_reviews.title: BEST VALUE BOAT!
customer_reviews.text: If you are tall or a little curvy, this is not the boat for you if you have 2 adults going into it, otherwise, this is a great little deal! I advise like many instructions say, inflating it, checking for leaks (because it is manufactured en masse) and give it some time to stretch and decompress from sitting in a box all stiff and awkward. if you don't, the first few times you use it, it will feel like there's a leak. That's what happens when the vinyl stretches. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: @FinReallyTwitch

customer_reviews.title: leakage in first time usage. disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: There's leakage from the seam. Contacted manufacturer for customer service but no response. I've bought so many things from Amazon, but this is the first time I feel disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This boat is good for the price. It takes about 10-15 minute to inflate by hand. It is a it hard to maneuver with 3 people inside. Maybe we need more oars. Enough room. So far we have one very tiny hole, after using it about 5 times, but we covered it with the patches supplied. Overall, pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to paddle since so wide. Carried us off in current.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a good idea but just too big to handle. Tried in water. Got carried off on current. Was going to return but just too big to roll back up. No way going back in box.
customer_reviews.author: Sara R.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for some goofing off
customer_reviews.text: Overall this boat is fun it’s great and durable. But it does not have much stability it was hard to get into and once in it was hard to sit up enough to row easily. Though it might be my fault for not inflating it enough. But over all it was fun for some creek riding and messing around! Also I got a car pump because yess it’s fast to use the provided pump but it does a number on your back! I got my air pump for $11 at Walmart!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great boat
customer_reviews.text: This is way bigger than expected. It floats like a champ and is plenty big enough for me and my 6 & 7 year old and a friend's 11 year old with room to spare. Would easily fit 4 adults with dry bags. It is a little long though so when carrying it when blown up it will bend in the middle making it hard to keep it off the ground, but not imposible. On bigger rapids it will fold a little in the middle so be careful. This boat is the talk amongst my friends though because of its size and pure awesomeness though.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Jordan

customer_reviews.title: easy to prepare to go out and easy to remove ...
customer_reviews.text: We've taken it out once, easy to prepare to go out and easy to remove when finished. I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: Great value, simple setup
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you definitely cant go wrong. This arrived 4 days early (YAY) after much excited anticipation. My boyfriend and I went out on it. Easy to get into from a boat dock. My only suggestion is if you are with someone else, sit facing each other or you are going to have a world of back discomfort. I love this and I cant wait to use it all season. I do kind of wish I got the bigger one so I could fit a few more people but this is exactly as its advertiesed!
customer_reviews.author: Karissa Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly sturdy almost hilarious hard to put down.
customer_reviews.text: I disliked that the air release valve kinda gets stuck if you tighten it too much and its hard as hell to open it back up without a very strong grip or tools. On the other side this is also a plus because when I bought this boat I was dead certain it might go belly up on the first trip and let us drown in a lake with 5 confirmed kills. That being said this beast is just incapable of going down, not without fight, and its gonna fight back. So would I buy this again? most definitley, hell I want to buy like six of this and make a grand caravan fleet.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Boat inside box
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the Seahawk 3 person boat and received a totally different boat - The K2 Kayak. Totally inconvenient! The shipping label said Seahawk but the actual boat inside the box was a Kayak. Of coarse the K2 Kayak was super heavy and inconvenient as now I have to pack it all up and also return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Boat!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement and it's even better than the previous Seahawk4! Love taking it to Patagonia Lake! We added a motor this time and it worked beautifully. The only thing you need to figure out if you're using a motor and battery is how to situate it in the boat since the bottom is not firm. We're still working that out but enjoying the ride in the meantime!!
customer_reviews.author: tabby93640

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Get this boat. Don't hesitate. I brought this to my friends camp on one of the finger lakes. Everyone was jealous and couldn't believe how cheap I got it! It was perfect for me and my two young boys as well. Big enough for them to move around with me in the boat. I wanted an alternative to something more tippy like a kayak or canoe. This was the answer and we LOVED taking this out on the water. Easy to maneuver and survived some rough weather tied out on the dock. Then deflated and takes up little space on a shelf in our garage. Can't wait to use again this summer!!
customer_reviews.author: Adison Tennant

customer_reviews.title: Anchors Away!  Great inflatable boat.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well-constructed appearing. It is amazingly big. Inflates and deflates quickly. The oars are a little flimsy and may need to be replaced at some point. 4 adults sat fairly comfortably in this (the largest adult was 215#). We used this to push out into the lake and swim off of. I was surprised we could climb back into it without it flipping over. It was stable enough for my daughter to dive off one end while I sat on the opposite end. Recommend! Can see it being used for fishing with a little trolling motor. Of note - very heavy when uninflated. Takes 2 people to carry. Excellent price when compared to other websites.
customer_reviews.author: Jannilynn

customer_reviews.title: Boatloads of fun.
customer_reviews.text: So much fun! And great for the price. We had a seahawk raft that we bought at Costco and it lasted us 10 years, until we lent it out and they popped it😓. So we had to replace it and we have been happy with this purchase. We have a small lake in our backyard so we keep this inflated all summer and keep it under trees and it does great. Holds our whole family (two adults and three kids) and we have also taken it river rafting a few times, mild rapids but super fun and enjoyable. Hopefully this will last us 10 years as well.
customer_reviews.author: laura momma

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This has been an amazing purchase. The boat itself is sturdy and easy to inflate / deflate as needed. Its holding capacity was better than expected. We had three large adults in it with plenty of room left over. It only loses a star because the paddles are really about 5 or 6 inches too short to get a really good rowing grip.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. G

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Boat for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I purchased this boat, ready for hurricane season! Harvey flooding came way too close for comfort! My husband was very impressed with the quality, size and ease of inflating the boat (pump included). I also purchased the canopy, cannot wait to get that. Looking forward to having some fun in it!!
customer_reviews.author: Trixie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and a great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a lake upstate. It's comfortable with two grown adults. 3 is a crowd because they end up needing to sit across the middle of the raft. Definitely does not seat 4 adults. It's very sturdy and easy to maneuver. They only give you two oars to row with. It's best if you had 4 because it's not very aerodynamic, so if you can find 2 more it'll get you where you need to be quicker. It's a good buy for the price and very durabile.
customer_reviews.author: J.Wong

customer_reviews.title: portable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: For the price the rubber raft is a good buy for anyone that is going fishing or just relaxing in a small pond. When folded can be transported in almost any car or truck. Can easily be inflated and put afloat in a few minutes. Plenty of space for gear, just hard to move around it once in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy villarreal

customer_reviews.title: PROS AND CONS TIME!!!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - seems strong, we've pulled it around here and there, 3 uses still no leaks as some negative reviews stated - cheap fun way to experience a lake Cons: - can't stand in the boat. They can charge an extra 10-20 for a sturdier bottom - the pump they include is flimsy broke on 2nd day - the oars stink. It's a 4 person boat yet they only include 2 oars. They barely get the boat moving.
customer_reviews.author: Mar2ne

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: This came in just in time for my weekend! Already made it a little more custom. I'm excited to see how it works out in the water! Theres plenty of space! It came with the ores and air pump. Filled with air in just a couple of minutes. Theres also fishing rod holders! The ore holders swivel. Very sturdy! The material feels like those jumpy houses for kiddos. O ky downside may be that not all 5 of us might fit out on water. But who knows, I have yet to find out! But I love it! My man loves it! My 3 kids love it! Already thinking about buying another one!
customer_reviews.author: Caffeine Obsessed

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy boat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for me and my three kids. It has been a lot of fun. It is well made and big, bigger than the roof of my minivan. It takes a lo g time to inflate.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great Value! Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Picture shows the Seahawk 4 on Georgian Bay, Ontario, Canada. We took it on a 2-week camping trip to The Massasauga Provincial Park. Very tough vinyl. Had no problems at all, it held up very well landing on the rocks. Just be careful not to overfill with air, should be about 1 p.s.i. We filled the 3 air chambers in just a few minutes with the included High Output Air Pump.
customer_reviews.author: ericjwin

customer_reviews.title: Love this little boat
customer_reviews.text: Love this little boat. Live in an apartment and drive a camry was looking for something to fish in with but I have no storage space. This boat was the answer. I did mods to it to help stability and comfort but have to say it's a good little boat. I will now purchase the motor mount to get a trolling motor. Rowing was easy. Yes it drifted in the wind but all boats do so not an issue. Met two other gents fishing the shore like I used to do, they now want one. My setup was purely for me fishing alone, 3 people I think would be a bit cramped 2 would be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Super easy and fun to get on the water. I sat on one side and my two kids fit great on the other.
customer_reviews.author: kay

customer_reviews.title: Best 4 adults inflatable boat
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t believe you can find such good durable boat at this price. 100% recommended
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to padle with
customer_reviews.text: It's really hard to padle with this compared to a hard duity boat. Because the boat is soft and the oaddle hoop us hard it Twist and makes it really difficult. This is fir a really small and calm lake. Be careful
customer_reviews.author: Datab

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how sturdy this raft was. It is comfortable for a raft and easy to maneuver. At first it is hard to blow up but, the second time around it blows up fairly fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: fluffy

customer_reviews.title: Bubbling in the water
customer_reviews.text: The plastic plugs were difficult to take apart and therefore made it hard to inflate and deflate the boat quickly. It was a nice boat quite durable looking but used it once and the bottom was bubbling in the water, had to return it after our first expedition.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Bovigny

customer_reviews.title: Safe raft
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my grandson and his fishing buddy. They have a ball with it. This gets them away from the shore and out to where the fish are. With an electric motor they can go anywhere on the lakes around here.They are really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L. Voss

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Steers a bit better than I expected. I bought it to go down the river and it's kinda shallow so u tend to rub over rocks. Most of them r very round and smooth so I didn't think it would be a problem. Well it got a few pin holes and one tear in only 2 trips. It's got several patches already. It's not a bad boat for a lake but not great for the river. The bottom isn't very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: scott vr6

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy little inflatable boat for myself and my husband. We cruise around our small fishing lake at home and we frequently deflate it to take camping with us. It stores nicely in a plastic tub.
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: River worthy
customer_reviews.text: This summer I took this boat six times down a river loaded with three people. We got stuck on rocks and sand and the bottom of the boat hold up. It is easy to fold and carry. The paddles are great. At the begging they came apart in the middle and we almost lost them but we figured out how to attach them extra hard and it's fine. I had lots of fun with this boat and it saved me money I would spent for a boat rental.
customer_reviews.author: Jana Broderick

customer_reviews.title: Watch out Mr Fish !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I put a 46lb trolling motor on the back! Also made a custom seating-area carpeted with nice comfort edges! Bought a JLF dual air pump with a pressure gauge to tell me when I have achieved a 1- bar read ( 14.5 psi )
customer_reviews.author: Roger B.

customer_reviews.title: Rubber seam popped up - Dangerous to use now
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this boat in February and it's been sitting on the pond on my farm since then. As the weather is heating up, I noticed that a couple of weeks back, the bed (sitting area) showed an unusual Pop in the middle as if the rubber seam has come off. It now has a weird looking inflated surface in the middle that makes this boat very unsafe. Wondering if there is any way to return / replace this at this point in time.
customer_reviews.author: Mahesh Ruikar

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: It is a very sturdy, steady inflatable boat. We have had3 adults over 250 pounds and my granddaughter in it and still felt steady and roomy. The only draw back is the raft has quick deflate valves ever were but the bottom which sucks takes longer to deflate bottom TV when to inflate the whole boat
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: Me and my boys took it out for a spin and it is so fun just what I wanted very sturdy very heavy weight I am going to take it out into the Florida springs this Monday! So excited thank you this was such a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Lelia

customer_reviews.title: All around happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Birthday present for my husband. I would definitely get an electric pump. We pu.ped it up with the manual pump that came with it and it was very tiring! Also the seats are 2 inflatable cushions that came with it - not a fan of that. Only comes with one set of oars but that wasnt a problem for us. Very easy to steer and sturdy! If you look on YouTube its also possible to hook up a small boat motor on the back and a plywood floor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’m a boat owner!
customer_reviews.text: Haha I’ve always wanted a boat but i live in the city in a studio apartment by myself. This inflatable boat is letting me live out my dreams! Haven’t taken it on the water yet but so far I’m super excited
customer_reviews.author: Fe-skits

customer_reviews.title: Great boat but a bit too much for my kids- do recommend though
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great boat but probably more than I needed- just wanted a sturdy boat that the kids could bang around in on the lake- it’s too heavy for them to carry ( 40lbs which isn’t that bad but ackward and bulky) - - I think it will be fun for my husband and me to fish from and we could probably all fit in ( 4 of us) if we wanted to paddle about. Great buy for the money and seems sturdy enough with the heavy gage plastic it’s made of
customer_reviews.author: LP LeD

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS BOAT!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We live at high altitude in Colorado so we don't get to swim very much, but with this boat at least we can be ON the water, if not IN it! It's really big, which is a blast for my kids and their friends to paddle around on the mountain lakes. If it's warm enough or they're just feeling brave they jump off the edge of the boat into the water! FUN TIMES!!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Got a faulty High Output Air pump and while pumping its coming out very frequently
customer_reviews.text: I got this product on 8th of August and I didn't get a chance to use it till 23rd of this month. Regarding the boat it is excellent, served as expected for such a price and too good for a family of 4. My daughter just loved it. It is too spacious inside and not too difficult in inflating and deflating. But the High Output Air Pump whatever we got along with this product doesn't work well. We got a faulty piece. I don't prefer to return the entire thing just for this single piece. Not sure what I need to do to get a conditioned one with out returning or exchanging the entire stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Sruthi

customer_reviews.title: It worked great! There was lots of room and the material ...
customer_reviews.text: I took this out with myself, my dog, and a cooler on a river float trip. It worked great! There was lots of room and the material is pretty durable. I put down blankets so the dog's nails wouldn't damage the raft and it wasn't an issue. I will say it was a little difficult to navigate with just one person. We sat pretty high in the water and when the wind blew against us I had to work pretty hard. But well worth it and I'm very excited to take it out on the river again!
customer_reviews.author: birdologist

customer_reviews.title: Rowing punctures this quickly
customer_reviews.text: I love these boats but they must be replaced often. We got ours 1 year ago and used it about 10 times. So relaxing! But we only got to use it once this year and rowing cracked and punctured the oarlock area. The rowing mechanism needs a new swivelly design so every stroke doesn’t “reef on” the oarlock so badly. We’ve had about 5 of these boats. Most lasted 1-2 summers. Not long enough. It seems like they were sturdier about 10 years ago. They seemed more “fabric-y” then. I think an old one lasted 3-4 years. Maybe longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: This is a great boat you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice and great boat! I love that it has fishing holders! People think that the paddles it comes with is kind of a pain but there fine for me. l also love you can put a motor on it which I have on mine! I use this on the lake and it holds up great! Trust me you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Peppery
